meanings.definition: To stare defiantly or boldly at someone
meanings.sent1: She outstares her opponent in the eye before the match begins.
meanings.sent2: He always outstares his classmates when he wants to show his determination.
meanings.sent3: The cat outstares the dog, making the dog back off playfully.
meanings.sent4: His intense gaze outstares any challenge that comes his way.
meanings.sent5: The outstaring contest between the siblings lasted for minutes, each refusing to look away.

meanings.definition: To surpass in staring or gaze intensity
meanings.sent1: The owl outstares all other birds with its piercing eyes in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The painting outstares the viewer, drawing them into its depths.
meanings.sent3: The sun outstares the clouds, shining brightly through them.
meanings.sent4: The mountain outstares the valley, standing tall and majestic.
meanings.sent5: The outstaring competition between the two statues captivates all who pass by.
